# üöÄ GitHub Pages + Render Deployment Guide

## Your Setup: 100% FREE Hosting

**Username:** BHABANISHANKAR-01  
**Frontend URL:** https://bhabanishankar-01.github.io/notes-sharing-app  
**Backend URL:** (will be generated by Render)

---

## STEP 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to: https://github.com/new
2. **Repository name:** `notes-sharing-app`
3. **Description:** Professional notes-sharing platform with code highlighting
4. **Visibility:** Public
5. **DO NOT** initialize with README, .gitignore, or license (you already have them)
6. Click **Create repository**

---

## STEP 2: Push Code to GitHub

Run these commands in PowerShell:

```powershell
cd d:\TN
git remote add origin https://github.com/BHABANISHANKAR-01/notes-sharing-app.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```

**Expected output:**
```
Enumerating objects: ...
Writing objects: ...
remote: Create a pull request for 'main' on GitHub by visiting:
Branch 'main' set up to track remote branch 'main' from 'origin'.
```

Verify on GitHub: https://github.com/BHABANISHANKAR-01/notes-sharing-app

---

## STEP 3: Deploy Backend on Render (FREE)

### 3a. Create Render Account

1. Go to: https://render.com
2. Click **Sign up** ‚Üí **Continue with GitHub**
3. Authorize Render to access your GitHub

### 3b. Deploy Backend

1. Click **New +** ‚Üí **Web Service**
2. Select your repository: `notes-sharing-app`
3. **Name:** `notes-backend`
4. **Environment:** Node
5. **Build Command:** `cd server && npm install`
6. **Start Command:** `cd server && node index.js`
7. **Click Create Web Service**

Render will build and deploy your backend.

### 3c. Set Environment Variables

While deploying, Render will ask for environment variables:

1. Click **Environment** tab
2. Add these variables:
   - `ADMIN_USERNAME` = `trainerMaster2025`
   - `ADMIN_PASSWORD` = `Code4NotesOnly`
   - `NODE_ENV` = `production`
   - `PORT` = `10000` (Render assigns this)

3. Click **Save**
4. Render will redeploy with your environment variables

### 3d. Get Your Backend URL

After deployment completes, you'll see:
```
Your site is live at: https://notes-backend-xxxxx.onrender.com
```

**Copy this URL!** You'll need it for the frontend.

---

## STEP 4: Update Frontend with Backend URL

### 4a. Update App.js

Edit `d:\TN\client\src\App.js`:

Find this line (around line 1-5):
```javascript
const API_BASE = 'http://localhost:5000/api'
```

Replace with:
```javascript
const API_BASE = 'https://your-render-url.onrender.com/api'
```

**Example:**
```javascript
const API_BASE = 'https://notes-backend-abc123.onrender.com/api'
```

### 4b. Commit and Push

```powershell
cd d:\TN
git add .
git commit -m "Update backend URL for production"
git push origin main
```

---

## STEP 5: Deploy Frontend to GitHub Pages

### 5a. Install gh-pages

```powershell
cd d:\TN\client
npm install gh-pages --save-dev
```

### 5b. Deploy Frontend

```powershell
cd d:\TN\client
npm run deploy
```

This will:
1. Build your React app
2. Create a `gh-pages` branch
3. Upload to GitHub Pages
4. Your app is now live!

**Access your app at:**
```
https://bhabanishankar-01.github.io/notes-sharing-app
```

---

## STEP 6: Test Your Live App

1. Open: https://bhabanishankar-01.github.io/notes-sharing-app
2. **Login with:**
   - Username: `trainerMaster2025`
   - Password: `Code4NotesOnly`
3. Create a course, add chapters and notes
4. Test code highlighting
5. Check analytics dashboard
6. Toggle dark mode

### Troubleshooting:

**Issue:** Blank page or 404 error
- **Fix:** Wait 2-3 minutes for GitHub Pages to deploy
- Refresh browser (Ctrl+F5)

**Issue:** API calls fail or login doesn't work
- **Fix:** Verify backend URL in `App.js` matches Render URL
- Render URLs take 1-2 minutes to warm up on first request (FREE tier)

**Issue:** Backend is slow
- **Reason:** Render FREE tier sleeps after 15 min
- **Behavior:** First request after sleep takes 5-10 seconds
- **Solution:** Just wait, second request will be fast

---

## Important Notes

### GitHub Pages (Frontend)
‚úÖ FREE and always running  
‚úÖ Global CDN for fast loading  
‚úÖ Automatic deployment with `npm run deploy`

### Render (Backend)
‚úÖ FREE tier  
‚úÖ Runs Node.js  
‚ö†Ô∏è Sleeps after 15 minutes of inactivity  
‚ö†Ô∏è First request after sleep is slow (5-10 sec)  
‚ö†Ô∏è Perfect for development/testing

---

## Updating Your App

Every time you make changes:

1. **Make changes locally**
   ```powershell
   # Edit files in d:\TN\server or d:\TN\client
   ```

2. **For backend changes:**
   ```powershell
   cd d:\TN
   git add server/
   git commit -m "Backend update: description"
   git push origin main
   ```
   Render auto-redeploys within 1 minute

3. **For frontend changes:**
   ```powershell
   cd d:\TN\client
   npm run deploy
   ```
   GitHub Pages updates within 1 minute

---

## Quick Command Reference

```powershell
# Initial setup
git remote add origin https://github.com/BHABANISHANKAR-01/notes-sharing-app.git
git push -u origin main

# Deploy frontend to GitHub Pages
cd d:\TN\client
npm install gh-pages --save-dev
npm run deploy

# Update backend code
cd d:\TN
git add server/
git commit -m "Update"
git push

# Update frontend code
cd d:\TN\client
npm run deploy
```
